attributes.action: Provide women's health physio to all post natal woman for pelvic health advice.
attributes.background: I gave birth at the end of last year to my second child and was shocked by a letter from my GP saying unless I had "persistent bleeding/pain or wanted contraception" a routine 6 weeks check up was not required. This left me with no checks post major abdominal surgery which is very worrying.
attributes.additional_details: Women's health physios are perfect professionals for assessing, and treating the mother post natally. They can check many concerns like scar tissue healing, gynae health and abdominal separation issues. Sadly mothers are being left without anyone to talk to about incontinence, prolapse,diastasis recti problems and all of these can be prevented or at least symptoms managed to avoid surgery further down the line. Providing care at this stage will save the NHS money in the long run.

attributes.action: Review the effectiveness of the outdated Child Destruction legislation
attributes.background: In June 2015 I was a victim of a violent assault during my 8th month of pregnancy. One of the two males who attacked me was the guy who got me pregnant. Unfortunately, this resulted in me giving birth to a stillborn baby boy Joel.
attributes.additional_details:
The Child Destruction legislation was introduced in 1929 as part of the Infant Life Act, to tackle late-term backstreet abortions. In modern times - though rarely used - the legislation has been used to convict perpetrators who have used violence with the intent to harm pregnant women whose babies are capable of living outside the mother's womb.

Due to the complexities of the law, there have been a number of inconsistencies when it comes to prosecuting and sentencing perpetrators.
#amendCDlaw

attributes.action: Ban the sale of single use plastic straws and cutlery in England
attributes.background:
The UK uses an estimated 8.5 million straw each years, which are amongst the top 10 items found in beach clean ups.

Plastic is damaging our ecosystem, not only killing animals, but also micro-plastics have been found in all water sources across the world - thought to be damaging to our health.
attributes.additional_details: Banning single use straws and cutlery across the UK would enable us to make a move towards environmental improvement.

attributes.action: Prevent developers & land speculators from “gaming the system” in UK housing.
attributes.background:
Change the five year land supply to develop the right number of houses in the right places in accordance with a sustainable, relevant and up-to-date Local Plan.
Introduce a local measure of pipeline & delivery of homes to ensure that non-performing developers or land speculators can be identified.
attributes.additional_details:
Putting the right homes in the right places:
Where an LPA can openly show a supply of undelivered housing or land that exceeds a six year horizon to cover local population growth, there shall be no rights of appeal on the basis of land supply.
Measuring the pipeline and delivery of homes:
Where new homes aren’t registered with the LPA at a rate in accordance with plans set out and agreed with that LPA, then DCLG shall have the right to declare the developers / land speculators as non-performing.

attributes.action: Fund Universities to explore new routes into Learning Disability Nursing
attributes.background: In order to ensure those with Learning Disabilities receive the best evidence-based care it is vital money is invested into developing new, affordable routes into nurse education to meet the needs of the Learning Disability Student demographic.
attributes.additional_details: Since the loss of student nursing bursaries in England, there has been a marked decline in the number of applicants to pre-registration Learning Disability Nursing courses. Applications from mature students, who have traditionally made up a large percentage of Learning Disability Nursing intakes, have fallen most drastically. This fall in applications is resulting in university courses across the country closing, threatening the future of the Learning Disability Nursing workforce.

attributes.action: To consider the removal of parental responsibility for absent parents.
attributes.background: As a single parent, I believe I should behold the right to make decisions based on the benefit of my child solely as her primary and only care giver.
attributes.additional_details: For example, if an absent father makes the choice to pay no attention their child, I don’t think it's acceptable for any single parent to have to resort to permission from said father regarding decisions the mother wishes to make such as health, schooling and country of residency, if it will work in the best interests of the child.

attributes.action: Keep freedom of movement for UK and EU Citizens as part of Brexit EU trade deal
attributes.background: The Leave side won the EU referendum in 2016, but there are voters on both sides who wish to keep EU freedom of movement rights post Brexit.  Freedom of movement is also essential for the NHS and companies across the UK and EU, we must fight to maintain it. Please sign if you agree.
attributes.additional_details: As the March 29th 2019 Brexit withdrawal deadline draws ever closer we must act before it's too late to save Freedom of movement rights for UK and EU Citizens post Brexit.  Think about the future and the opportunities that EU freedom of movement rights offer with the ability to work, live, study and retire across the EU 28.

attributes.action: Automatic by-election if MPs resigns from their current party
attributes.background: If a Member of Parliament decides to leave the party they were elected under, then they should be required to call a by-election and stand as an independent or for another party.

attributes.action: The EU referendum result must be dismissed as not fit for purpose
attributes.background: On its own admission, the government should have included a double majority as a criterion for implementing the EU referendum result. In 2015 in a debate on an SNP amendment requiring this and other safeguards, David Lidington stated that these were not necessary as the referendum was advisory only.
attributes.additional_details: The obvious conclusion we can draw from this is that the government believed that a binding referendum would require these checks and balances. David Cameron then proceeded to change the status of the referendum to binding by promising to implement the result but failed to change the majority criteria. We do not believe that a 3.8% majority, after a shameful campaign, is a mandate for such a huge constitutional change, nor the dismissal of 48% of the electorate, Scotland and Northern Ireland.

attributes.action: Grant leave to remain to Brenda Ackerman and change the Immigration Rules
attributes.background: Brenda is a frail 71-yr-old South African who is at risk of being removed to SA. Brenda has been living with her daughter, British son-in-law and 19 & 16-yr-old granddaughters since 2006 & is dependent on them & they on her. Her removal risks resulting in “intense suffering” & “large risk of death”.
attributes.additional_details: Since July 2012, the immigration rules have made it almost impossible for British citizens to bring their elderly parents to the UK to care for them. As Brenda’s barrister, I am calling on the Govt to change the Immigration Rules to the pre-2012 Immigration Rules which allowed British nationals and other settled persons to be joined by their parents/grandparents aged 65 & over if they could accommodate and maintain them without reliance on public funds to avoid situations like Brenda's arising.

attributes.action: If no agreement on the Ireland Border can be reached, Brexit must be abandoned.
attributes.background: Peace in Northern Ireland is a valuable achievement, given decades of sectarian violence before 1998. No vague promises of benefits on Brexit can compensate for losing this. Allowing for consultation with the other states, if no settlement  by 1 October, we must withdraw Article 50.
attributes.additional_details:
It is a major concern for many of us here, and also many in the Irish Republic and the EU, that a `hard border' between the Irish Republic and Northern Ireland will cause serious unrest.

The Good Friday Agreement of 1998 ended the violence and terrorism. but this will return once customs and immigration controls are reimposed. It is reason enough to stop the process of leaving the EU. The safety of the British people is too important to be sacrificed for what is in reality vague promises

attributes.action: Let the UK vote for the next London Mayor. It is our capital after all!
attributes.background: London being the capital of the United Kingdom, I believe we should all have a say in who runs it who is elected to be the mayor
attributes.additional_details: After the disastrous last few years of Sadiq Khan being the mayor of London, let the people of the country elect the next mayor, as it does affect the rest of the country, what does and does not happen in London seems to have a roll on effect.

attributes.action: Restrict the trade in, and private keeping of, dangerous wild animals
attributes.background: The Dangerous Wild Animals Act 1976 is inadequate to ensure welfare for animals and human safety. The Born Free Foundation is calling for a review of the law on the sale and keeping of wild animals and for greater restrictions on the trade in, and ownership of, dangerous wild animals in particular
attributes.additional_details: Freedom of Information requests to Local Authorities across Britain show the following animals are licensed to be kept privately: Nearly 300 wild cats, including more than 40 big cats such as lions, tigers, and leopards; more than 80 venomous lizards; more than 230 primates, including vervet monkeys, spider monkeys and lemurs; more than 75 crocodilians, such as crocodiles and alligators; more than 700 venomous snakes, including puff adders, black mambas and diamondback rattlesnakes

attributes.action: Abolish all subsidies for shotgun and firearms licences
attributes.background: The cost for a shotgun licence and renewal currently does not cover the full costs of licensing, leaving the public to pick up the shortfall. This is clearly unacceptable, especially when you consider that the majority of us have no interest in killing animals for enjoyment
attributes.additional_details: The cost of a firearms licence has, for some reason, barely risen since 2001. The cost of a shotgun licence renewal is £49 but police forces put the cost of administration at around £200, leaving already stretched police forces, and of course ourselves, with unnecessary costs. The full cost of administrating licensing should be borne by the license holders.

attributes.action: Fund facilities for people who feel suicidal so they always have somewhere to go
attributes.background: Often people who feel suicidal are discharged from mental health services, against their will. This can gravely increase the risk to their lives and causes needless deaths. No one who feels suicidal and asks for help should be turned away.
attributes.additional_details: There should always be somewhere for people who feel suicidal to go where they can receive professional help and feel safe. This would also prevent the high numbers who resort to going to A&E to try and find help because there are so few alternatives. Let's protect vulnerable people.

attributes.action: Remove articles 28-35 inclusive in chapter 6 of the offensive weapons bill.
attributes.background: These clauses in the Bill seek to make certain firearms illegal. This is wholly unnecessary with the robust firearms licensing that is implemented in the UK to protect public safety. None of the equipment contained in these clauses have ever been used in a crime on UK soil.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the handgun ban in 1997, lawful firearms shooters at Home Office Approved clubs have not been able to use such items however the career criminals easily procure these items for their illegal activities. 
Further firearms restrictions proposed in this bill are not the prudent way forward in tackling the root causes of crime and will have zero effect on the reduction of violent crime in the UK. The Government need a holistic approach to education, welfare and policing, which in time will yield lower crime statistics nationally. This is where policy should be concentrated.

attributes.action: Mandatory EHCPs  for children with Autism.
attributes.background: As a parent to a little boy with autism it's something I feel very strongly about.It's an injustice not to put appropriate supports in school for children with a disability.

attributes.action: Provide Medway funding to build Abbey court special needs secondary school
attributes.background: Abbey court is the only school in medway which caters for profoundly disabled children.There is not enough places at the secondary school due to it being to small and not purpose built for disabled children. We are calling on the government to help fund the build of a secondary school
attributes.additional_details: Abbey court primary moved to a new site in 2017. Medway ran out of money to build the secondary site(land and permission to build is there).Medway stipulated that abbey court primary has to take on ex amount of extra pupils per year, which had now caused there not to be enough secondary spaces therefor our children will be sent out of borough or placed in residential school miles away from loved ones or pulled out of the education system. Every child has a right to education disabled or not

attributes.action: Abolish the house of lords.
attributes.background:
The unelected house of lords are going against the will of the British people. 17.4 million voters want a brexit consisting of leaving the single market & leaving the customs union.
The house of lords wish to block this therefore they must be abolished.

attributes.action: Invoke the Parliament Act if the Lords reject the EU (Withdrawal) Bill
attributes.background: Brexit is democratically mandated by the referendum and manifestos of parties in Government. If the Lords reject the EU (Withdrawal) Bill, the Government must prorogue Parliament immediately and work quickly to meet the conditions to use the Parliament Acts so that the Bill can receive Royal Assent.
attributes.additional_details: The Parliament Acts assert the supremacy of the House of Commons over the House of Lords. Section 2 allows the EU (Withdrawal) Bill to be presented for Royal Assent by the Commons provided certain conditions are met. We voted to Leave the EU to restore sovereignty to the British people, for freedom and self-determination. We voted for a clean break. Lets begin this new chapter in our history by honouring the wishes of our people. Facebook.com/Brexiteers

attributes.action: Stop intrusive access to counselling notes, in rape and sexual assault cases.
attributes.background: If a victim reports a sexually violent crime, they will be told they are entitled to solo/group counselling but will be strongly advised to take neither until after the trial. This is due to lawyers attaining access to counselling notes and potentially using their words against them in court.
attributes.additional_details:
Only 15% of sexual violence is reported to the police, and approximately 90% of those who are raped know the perpetrator before the offence. A victim of a crime of this nature should be able to speak emotionally and freely in a safe space, with a counsellor, without being worried about potential repercussions in court.

This depraved law is not only morally wrong and wholly unjust. It is undoubtedly detrimental to a victims' mental health and needs to be challenged.

attributes.action: Make St Georges Day a Bank Holiday in England.
attributes.background:
A nation’s patron Saint should be celebrated. 

England is one of a very select few who do not hold the privilege of being granted their National Patron Saints day off work as a Bank Holiday.

attributes.action: UK to raise the state pension to the OECD figure of 63% of average earnings.
attributes.background:
The OECD reports that the UK has the lowest state pension of any OECD country. 
This is a disgrace.
I ask for a full parliamentary debate on the issue.
UK workers retire on about 29% of average earnings, the average OECD figure is 63%.
All developed EU countries pay their pensioners more.
attributes.additional_details:
A political consensus was reached by EU Nations at the Laeken Summit in 2001, that each member state, would attempt to attain a Basic Pension of 40% of average earnings by 2007 and then work towards 60%.
In 2017 the UK state pension was £7,440.
France £15,811.
Germany £26,366.
Spain £26,630.
By 2050 Germany and Spain plan devoting 16% of GDP to Basic State Pensions. 
The UK looks likely to be still devoting only 4% of GDP. 
UK politicians should not ignore such massive pension differences.

attributes.action: Abolish the killing of stray animals in Council shelters!
attributes.background: Currently it is legal for Council shelters to destroy stray dogs, cats etc. in 7 days if they are not reclaimed or taken in by a rescue such as Dog's Trust, Cats Protection or another animal charity!
attributes.additional_details: I would like the Government to abolish the killing of animals in Council shelters, turn them into People's Rescues and afford them charity status, so as the public can keep these animals alive via contributions!

attributes.action: Water safety/drowning prevention & effects of cold water to be taught in schools
attributes.background: In 2016 we saw the launch of the first ever water safety strategy in the UK which aims to reduce water related fatalities by 50% by 2026. Collaboration, awareness, education and prevention are the main focuses.
attributes.additional_details: Like many others i learned the hard way my 1st born son lost his life swimming in open water aged 13. The 1st time I heard the words "cold water shock" was when I was looking up how my physically fit son could have died. I started visiting schools in my son's memory to teach the dangers in & around open water my son was not alone in not knowing the dangers in fact he was part of a majority. This needs to change water safety/ drowning prevention needs to be a part of our national curriculum now!

attributes.action: Ban Anti-LGBTQ+ material from schools.
attributes.background: There has been a recent influx of anti-LGBT+ material being sent to schools in England. We are asking that any and all material, that is first and foremost designed to give a negative view of the LGBT+ community, be removed from schools.
attributes.additional_details:
Examples of how such material can be shown to be anti-LGBT+:
• they recommend conversion therapy. 
• they scaremonger about conditions that are not legally recognised as clinical or medical conditions. 
• they encourage school staff to break equality laws as stated in the EA2010. 
• they give false information regarding the legally available treatment for transgender youth in the UK.
 https://www.cps.gov.uk/legal-guidance/homophobic-biphobic-and-transphobic-hate-crime-prosecution-guidance

attributes.action: Mandatory training in ALL aspects of Domestic abuse for Family courts & Cafcass.
attributes.background:
Judiciary, Cafcass & Family court to be fully trained in domestic abuse, gas lighting, coercive control, stalking, sexual abuse, financial abuse, emotional abuse, harassment and its effects on the Family. 
70-90% of Family court & Cafcass cases involve DA.
Training would enable informed decisions
attributes.additional_details:
Daily decisions are made on recommendations by Cafcass for contact with perpetrators enforced by courts affecting families.

15 children were murdered in 2015 during contact that was enforced.

Training is essential for the safeguarding of all children and survivors.

http://safelives.org.uk/sites/default/files/resources/SafeLives%20Annual%20Impact%20Report%202016-17_web.pdf

https://www.naccc.org.uk/downloads/NewsItems/APPG_Inquiry_report_Domestic_Abuse_Child_Contact_and_the_Family_Court.pdf

attributes.action: Make it legal requirement to publish carbohydrate values of food in restaurants
attributes.background:
Over 4 million people in the UK have Diabetes.
In order to give the correct dose of Insulin with a meal, it's imperative to have accurate carbohydrate values available.
Without this, a diabetic is forced to guess and could either under/over medicate which can cause life threatening complications!

attributes.action: Order for a new and updated Family Justice Review Report to be completed.
attributes.background: The last Family Justice Review was filled in November 2011. Almost 7 years ago. A new Family Justice Review is long overdue and a new updated report should be conducted to further improve the Family Justice System.
attributes.additional_details: The last and Final Family Justice Review Report was completed by Mr Norgove in November 2011. The government should now consider a new and updated Family Justice Review Report to be completed. There are many changes and improvements that could be discussed for instance; Fathers are not granted automatic parental responsibility like mothers are. The impact of Parental Alienation abuse and how the Justice system intends to address this. Further ways to encourage and facilitate contact for children

attributes.action: Scrap the cap on international doctors being allowed to work in the NHS
attributes.background: We call for the removal of visa restrictions preventing international doctors from working in the UK. Since Dec 2017 over 1500 visa applications from doctors who have secured NHS jobs have been refused. Meanwhile 100s of posts are vacant, waiting times are rising and patient safety is under threat.
attributes.additional_details:
Denying doctors who have secured jobs in the NHS from entering the UK does not make sense. Hospitals are wasting money on recruitment and are being forced to cover shifts with locum doctors - if they can find them. 
Gaps in rotas mean doctors are juggling large numbers of patients and stress among the profession is rising.  
International doctors are ready to work in the NHS. Scrap the cap and let them take up their posts. 
https://www.bmj.com/scrap-the-cap

attributes.action: Make it a requirement of law to label all Halal certified products as such.
attributes.background: Many products that are Halal certified fail to carry the logo that informs people. We, as non-Muslims, feel that it should be a legal requirement for companies to label products as such, which gives us a choice on whether to buy that product or choose a non-certified option.
attributes.additional_details: The list that was on a particular certification website has been removed following a revamp. This information should be available readily.

attributes.action: Stop the Loan Charge 2019 from being applied retrospectively
attributes.background: The 2019 Loan Charge seeks to historically tax a significant proportion of UK freelance workers for employment arrangements they used over the last twenty years. This is estimated to affect around 100,000 workers across all sectors.
attributes.additional_details:
20 years of Government inaction has meant they need a scapegoat. And the scapegoat in this instance is not only your big money footballers and celebrities but your average Joe contractor. A contractor working for 5 years on a salary of £30,000 could be liable for a sum of around £40,000.

It would be unsurprising if Freelancers as a result are pushed into family breakdown, depression and sadly even suicide. Monies that have been saved for years will be wiped out overnight.

attributes.action: We want a world class radiotherapy service accessible for all cancer patients.
attributes.background: We want the best radiotherapy treatment for cancer as close to home as possible. 1 in 2 of us will at some point develop cancer, meaning 1 in 4 of us need radiotherapy at some point in our lifetime. More investment is critical; despite the need, radiotherapy only receives 5% of the UK cancer budget.
attributes.additional_details: We’re asking to increase the NHS Cancer budget dedicated to radiotherapy from 5% to 6.5%, and a one-off £250 million investment to modernise existing machines and build satellite radiotherapy centres to ensure accessible service nationwide. UK cancer survival rates are well below European average. If the UK achieved best European levels, 10k more patients would survive per year. Radiotherapy has a huge part to play in giving the people of the UK the cancer treatment service they deserve.
attributes.creator_name: Prof Pat Price, Chairman, Action Radiotherapy

attributes.action: Kids with allergies must have a right to eat safe food from home at eateries.
attributes.background: We were recently humiliated and almost refused service when we brought home made food for our son, who has life threatening allergies, to a play centre. We believe that this is a form of discrimination. Parents should have the right to provide safe food for their children without being shamed.
attributes.additional_details: Since my experience, I have discovered many other similar stories where parents are publicly shamed. We are an invisible group who are discriminated against but have no protection under the law. We would like to enjoy going out as a family knowing that our children are safe.

attributes.action: Remove Capita from recruiting for the Army and use Soldiers to recruit Soldiers
attributes.background: Army Careers is run by Capita under a £1.3 billion deal. However they are not fit for purpose. They fail to meet targets yet still make large profits. Their staff who have no actual experience in the Army lack the ability to inspire potential recruits to join.
attributes.additional_details:
In some cases the first time a recruit meets someone in uniform is when they arrive in training.


http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/armed-forces-army-recruitment-crisis-mark-francois-report-filling-the-ranks-navy-raf-lack-of-a7929411.html

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.theregister.co.uk/AMP/2017/12/08/capita_recruiting_partnership_project_borked/

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/austerity-british-army-recruitment-crisis-philip-hammond-cuts-capita-outsourcing-not-enough-trained-a7825626.html

attributes.action: Rebury remains of WW2 Royal Navy sailors dug up by metal scavengers in Indonesia
attributes.background: This petition calls on the Government to rebury the remains of British Royal Navy WW2 sailors, who died on HMS Exeter and HMS Electra, that were dug up and dumped in an anonymous mass grave in Indonesia by metal scavengers. We want these remains recovered and buried with the dignity they deserve.
attributes.additional_details:
Reports in the Guardian, the Dutch and Indonesian media state since 2014 up to 40 WW2 vessels in the Java sea have been partially or completely destroyed by metal scavengers. This includes the disturbing and dumping of remains of WW2 Royal Navy sailors, who died on British warships, HMS Exeter, HMS Electra and HMS Encounter in an anonymous mass grave. 

The Guardian article is here

https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/jan/22/bodies-of-second-world-war-sailors-in-java-sea-dumped-in-mass-grave

attributes.action: Remove shortage occupation codes and NHS roles from Tier 2 Visa cap
attributes.background: Since December 2017, the points required to obtain a Restricted Certificate of Sponsorship (RCOS) has more than doubled - from 21 points (for nearly the entire history of the points based system) to 46 - 55 points. The months long breaching of this cap is negatively impacting NHS and business needs.
attributes.additional_details:
Removal NHS roles from the RCOS cap will allow swifter entrance for badly needed NHS staff including doctors, therapists, and key support positions, helping to ease the growing pressures faced by the service. 

Additionally, removal of the shortage occupation codes will allow businesses to more fairly compete for international talent. 

See below:

http://www.bbc.com/news/health-43898969 

https://www.peoplemanagement.co.uk/news/articles/businesses-unable-recruit-overseas-visa-limit-breached

attributes.action: An Independent Commission into the Home Office and the "hostile environment"
attributes.background:
The Windrush Scandal and Amber Rudd’s resignation have shown the chaotic and cruel way the Home Office operates.
 
This crisis was caused by Theresa May’s “hostile environment” policy. The policy ruins lives, puts people at risk of destitution and removal, and increases the risk of modern slavery.
attributes.additional_details:
It asks landlords and doctors to act as border guards and there is no evidence that the policy works.

Migrants and those who look or sound 'foreign' are at most risk. 

We can no longer trust that the Home Office can function effectively and fairly.

We need an Independent Commission to look into the behaviour of the Home Office and its “hostile environment”. It is the only way to ensure that all those caught up in Theresa May’s “hostile environment” are protected.

attributes.action: Don't change how Parliament’s popular and successful guided tours are run
attributes.background: For 18 years, Parliament tours have been led by professional Blue Badge Guides and experienced in-house guides. The tours have won awards and Parliament is top rated on TripAdvisor. Tours generate income for Parliament. Under new proposals 200+ professionals will stop receiving work from Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: The House authorities plan to replace the current qualified guides with a downsized team. In our view, the case for this change is based on inaccurate information and flawed financial analysis. MPs and Peers have declared their support for our campaign. The proposals also call for substantial investment in a plan to guide in a building facing closure for refurbishment in seven years' time. We believe that this proposal is misguided and does not represent a good use of taxpayers' money.

attributes.action: Prohibit the removal of trees/shrubs from riverbanks & in-river wildlife habitat
attributes.background: Vital wildlife habitat for protected species like otters bats & water voles is regularly destroyed plus nesting sites for birds & refuges for fish from predation.This is carried out without the threat of prosecution. Such actions must be licensed & subject to full environmental impact assessments.
attributes.additional_details: The Angling Trust has highlighted many situations where important habitat has been removed and even on occasion found evidence of the EA removing habitat that they themselves had helped to install. Landowners and the EA need clear incentives to manage riverine environments for the maximum benefit of wildlife.  Modern flood defense strategies have failed to look at the impact on river habitat removal and the wildlife that depends on it for its survival.

attributes.action: Make diagnosis enough for children with SEN to get the help and provision needed
attributes.background: Throughout the UK there are thousands of children struggling in mainstream school. My son is one of many. He is Aspergers/ADHD. He needs a specialist provision and one on one support. He and all of the other children are made to fail the system before they qualify for help. Something needs to change
attributes.additional_details:
* Diagnosis should be enough for a specialist provision
* Support should be given immediately to children whose parents choose for them to stay in mainstream
* Children have to fail in mainstream before they can get assistance, the system is failing our children
* EHCP process takes too long
* Funding needs to be increased
* We need more specialist schools
* ALL children deserve the right to an education in a setting that suits their needs.
* SEN Children need SEN support

attributes.action: Declare a Climate Emergency, end fossil fuel use and build community resilience.
attributes.background: The current wave of extreme weather around the globe and in Britain indicates that the climate emergency predicted by our scientists is now here.  We must prepare for community resilience in the face of climate impacts and take urgent steps to limit warming and reverse temperatures to 1980s levels.

attributes.action: Make the wearing of cycle helmets for children law.
attributes.background: Wearing my cycle helmet saved my life! It protected my head when I hit the road and from the hot exhaust when I was trapped under the car. The helmet was amazing as it was damaged and melted but still intact. Now I want all children to have to wear helmets.
attributes.additional_details:
My accident happened while cycling to school. I came off my bike head first, landing in front of a car, which drove over me, trapping me beneath. The air ambulance attended and I was flown to hospital. I sustained three breaks, a fracture and lost some teeth. 

The consultant said I wouldn't have survived without a helmet.  

I want you all to understand it can happen to anyone....as it happened to me!

attributes.action: Make burning or mistreating a Union Jack in public a criminal offence.
attributes.background: There is nothing more offensive to loyal British subjects than seeing protesters destroying our nation's flag. It elicits feelings of anger and revulsion and can be a precursor to violence. It is not unreasonable to expect our nation's flag to be treated with respect.

attributes.action: The holiday  homes industry to have tighter, stricter regulations.
attributes.background: The holiday homes industry to have tighter, strict regulations to safeguard customers losing money. These regulations to safeguard owners in a similar way that the park homes are protected.

attributes.action: Make the Early Years Teacher Status on par with the Qualified Teacher Status
attributes.background: The EYFS (0-5 years) is a crucial part of a child's life which requires careful and considered teaching. Early Years Teacher Status is not recognised as a teaching qualification in state schools but rather an unqualified teacher and therefore impacts on both pay and job opportunities in schools.
attributes.additional_details: In order to gain Early Years Teacher Status, an individual must complete a teaching portfolio which covers all 8 teaching standards alongside completing 120 days on placement in a variety of settings and 12 days in Key Stage 1 and 2. To complete all of the above and not be regarded as a teacher is demoralising to the hard graft that is put into our early years education system. The pay gap between an EYT and a QT is also shameful, emphasising the lack of respect for early years workers.

attributes.action: Allow existing Ambulance Staff Career progression without being penalised
attributes.background: The new pay deal in the NHS is detrimental to existing Ambulance staff who wish to progress with their career. This pay deal will have the effect of hampering staff development/promotion and this could lead to a skills shortage in the next few years of experienced ambulance personnel.
attributes.additional_details:
The new NHS Pay deal included 7 words which will hamper the development of ambulance staff as any existing member of staff who has a "changes of roles (including promotion)." will be forced to a new way of being paid their unsocial hours allowance which will be detrimental for certain staff and incur the loss of up to £2.5K.

We want existing Ambulance staff to be able to progress in their careers without fear of changes to their terms and conditions and to their unsocial hours pay.

attributes.action: Introduce a Minister for Older People in England, as they have in Wales.
attributes.background:
This role needs to be established because currently nobody is taking overall responsibility for ensuring society treats older citizens fairly.
Pensioners in England, to whom we owe a huge debt of gratitude, should be treated with the dignity, care and respect.
attributes.additional_details: For far too long, an undercurrent of inter-generational strife has been building, with the elderly being targeted to take money from in order to help younger generations. However most young people would not wish to see pensioners deprived of their rights, or left in poverty. We need someone to liaise across Government departments, such as Treasury and Health, to ensure fairness for the wellbeing of older generations.

attributes.action: Fund life saving Immunotherapy for lung cancer patients to more than 2 years
attributes.background: Currently Pembrolizumab (immunotherapy) is only an option for 24 months if you have lung cancer. If you have Melanoma it is given until it either stops working or the side effects become too much, no time limit.
attributes.additional_details:
Lung cancer is a bigger killer yet after 24 months they take the option away
 
I believe I am possibly the 1st or one of the first to reach the 2 years on this. When I was given it, it was my last hope as chemotherapy did not work and I was not that well at all. I went on this as an early trial in June 2016 as a last hope! had my last treatment in June 2018. I was originally given 6 to 12 months to live. But this has given me brilliant results and extra time with my kids and family. Now it has been taken away with nothing else offered. More people will be in this situation very soon. We all need help, if you could sign and share this I would be so grateful.
 
We just want to be able to spend more time with our families. Thank you

attributes.action: Make it the law for all cats to be microchipped
attributes.background: The microchipping of dogs became UK law back in 2016. I am calling for the same protection to be given to cats. Each year hundreds of thousands of cats are injured, lost and killed on our roads, a high percentage of which are often not microchipped. Of the ones that survive, many end up in shelters
